title: Hanban funds establishment of Confucius Institute at University of Sarajevo
description: The first Confucius Institute was established in Bosnia and Herzegovina in April 2, 2015. The institute was established by the University of Sarajevo in coordination with its partner Chinese university, the Northwest Normal University in Lanzhou, Gansu province.   The establishment followed an agreement on 7 December 2014 between the University of Sarajevo and Hanban. Liu Zhongkui, the president of Lanzhou's Northwest Normal University attended the ceremony and signed the cooperation framework with University of Sarajevo. The two sides reached all-round agreements in regards to the exchanging of teachers and students. The new institute also received the support of the Confucius Institute Headquarters (Hanban).  The institute is expected to open a Chinese language course this September. It is the third overseas Confucius Institute supported by Northwest Normal University.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Hanban funds establishment of Confucius Institute at University of Sarajevo

# Description
The first Confucius Institute was established in Bosnia and Herzegovina in April 2, 2015. The institute was established by the University of Sarajevo in coordination with its partner Chinese university, the Northwest Normal University in Lanzhou, Gansu province.   The establishment followed an agreement on 7 December 2014 between the University of Sarajevo and Hanban. Liu Zhongkui, the president of Lanzhou's Northwest Normal University attended the ceremony and signed the cooperation framework with University of Sarajevo. The two sides reached all-round agreements in regards to the exchanging of teachers and students. The new institute also received the support of the Confucius Institute Headquarters (Hanban).  The institute is expected to open a Chinese language course this September. It is the third overseas Confucius Institute supported by Northwest Normal University.
justification: Project focuses on educational and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Confucius Institute, Chinese language course, educational exchange agreements

title: Chinese Government provides grant for establishment of Chinese Culture Corner at University of East Sarajevo
description: In 2015, China donated funds for the building of the Chinese Culture Corner within the Faculty of Philosophy at the University of East Sarajevo. The Corner opened on December 26, 2016, and was organized by the Department of Sinology. The corner was supposed to serve as a preliminary institution until the introduction of a full Confucius Institute at the University of East Sarajevo.
staff_comments: Please be aware that the University of East Sarajevo is a derivative of the University of Sarajevo but is not at the same location, therefore the Confucius institute established on the main campus in 2015 (42855) is not the potential institute referenced in these sources.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides grant for establishment of Chinese Culture Corner at University of East Sarajevo

# Description
In 2015, China donated funds for the building of the Chinese Culture Corner within the Faculty of Philosophy at the University of East Sarajevo. The Corner opened on December 26, 2016, and was organized by the Department of Sinology. The corner was supposed to serve as a preliminary institution until the introduction of a full Confucius Institute at the University of East Sarajevo.
justification: Project focuses on cultural and educational development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Chinese Culture Corner, educational institution focus

title: Chinese Government dispatches 14th medical team to Nyangabgwe Referral Hospital and Princess Marina Hospital
description: The Chinese Government has been sending medical teams to Botswana since 1981. Fujian Province has been responsible for sending the teams. On February 13, 2015, the Chinese Government and the Government of Botswana signed an agreement, officially dispatching the 14th medical team to Botswana. China’s Ambassador to Botswana Zheng Zhuqiang and Botswana's Minister of Health Dorcas Makgato-Malesu signed the agreement in Gaborone, capital of Botswana.   The 14th medical team consisted of 46 members (including 30 doctors, 10 nurses and 6 support staff) who were stationed at Nyangabgwe Referral Hospital in the city of Francistown and Princess Marina Hospital in the city of Gaborone. The team, which included cardiac surgeons, physicians, oncologists, and gynaecologists, completed its term of service between June 8, 2015 and June 20, 2017.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 14th medical team to Nyangabgwe Referral Hospital and Princess Marina Hospital

# Description
The Chinese Government has been sending medical teams to Botswana since 1981. Fujian Province has been responsible for sending the teams. On February 13, 2015, the Chinese Government and the Government of Botswana signed an agreement, officially dispatching the 14th medical team to Botswana. China’s Ambassador to Botswana Zheng Zhuqiang and Botswana's Minister of Health Dorcas Makgato-Malesu signed the agreement in Gaborone, capital of Botswana.   The 14th medical team consisted of 46 members (including 30 doctors, 10 nurses and 6 support staff) who were stationed at Nyangabgwe Referral Hospital in the city of Francistown and Princess Marina Hospital in the city of Gaborone. The team, which included cardiac surgeons, physicians, oncologists, and gynaecologists, completed its term of service between June 8, 2015 and June 20, 2017.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team deployment to hospitals, healthcare service provision

title: Chinese Government donates P170,000 to Botswana Workcamps Association (BWA)
description: In 2015, the Chinese Embassy together with Charity Association of Chinese in Botswana donated P170,000 to Botswana Workcamps Association (BWA) for its agricultural project and skills training fund. The intention of the BWA was to use the funds to make sure that young people were trained to acquire business acumen and later refer them to relevant government department for funding. Chinese Ambassador Mr Zheng Zhuqiang was involved with the transaction.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Government donates P170,000 to Botswana Workcamps Association (BWA)

# Description
In 2015, the Chinese Embassy together with Charity Association of Chinese in Botswana donated P170,000 to Botswana Workcamps Association (BWA) for its agricultural project and skills training fund. The intention of the BWA was to use the funds to make sure that young people were trained to acquire business acumen and later refer them to relevant government department for funding. Chinese Ambassador Mr Zheng Zhuqiang was involved with the transaction.
justification: Project focuses on skills training and youth development rather than direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Agricultural project and skills training fund, focus on youth business acumen development

title: Chinese Government provides $1.7 million grant for provision of conservation and wildlife protection equipment to Botswana Wildlife Authority
description: On July 15, 2015, the Chinese government and Botswana Ministry of Environment, Wildlife and Tourism jointly announced a donation of $1.7 million worth of goods from the Chinese government for wildlife protection.  On January 27, 2016, Zheng Zhuqiang, the Chinese Ambassador to Botswana, officially gave the Botswana Ministry of Environment, Wildlife, and Tourism $1.7 million USD worth of wildlife protection equipment including generators, solar panels, sleeping bags, GPS computers, and uniforms on behalf of the Chinese government. The equipment donation serves as help for the wildlife ministry due to its limited financial capacity and difficulty implementing anti-poaching projects. Tshekedi Khama, the Minister of Wildlife, Environment and Tourism thanked China for the donations. The donation appears to have been completed.
combined_text:
# Sector
GENERAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION

# Title
Chinese Government provides $1.7 million grant for provision of conservation and wildlife protection equipment to Botswana Wildlife Authority

# Description
On July 15, 2015, the Chinese government and Botswana Ministry of Environment, Wildlife and Tourism jointly announced a donation of $1.7 million worth of goods from the Chinese government for wildlife protection.  On January 27, 2016, Zheng Zhuqiang, the Chinese Ambassador to Botswana, officially gave the Botswana Ministry of Environment, Wildlife, and Tourism $1.7 million USD worth of wildlife protection equipment including generators, solar panels, sleeping bags, GPS computers, and uniforms on behalf of the Chinese government. The equipment donation serves as help for the wildlife ministry due to its limited financial capacity and difficulty implementing anti-poaching projects. Tshekedi Khama, the Minister of Wildlife, Environment and Tourism thanked China for the donations. The donation appears to have been completed.
justification: Project focuses on wildlife protection and conservation without direct energy or environmental transition implications
evidence: Donation of wildlife protection equipment, focus on anti-poaching and conservation efforts

title: Chinese Government donates video conferencing equipment to Botswana's Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation worth $2.8 million
description: On May 22, 2015, China donated video conferencing equipment valued at about $2.8 million to Botswana's Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation. The equipment was supplied by Huawei and was installed at the ministry headquarters and Botswana's high commission in Pretoria, South Africa.

title: Chinese Government provides technical assistance to support Golden Jubilee Celebrations in Botswana
description: In September 2016, the Chinese Embassy permitted the involvement of the China Yunnan Shangri-La arts troupe in the golden jubilee celebrations in Botswana. China also sent stretching and professional fitness coaches to Botswana, as well as costumes, performing equipment, and other materials to help the country celebrate BOT50, the Botswana independence celebration. This technical assistance comes as a way to blend Chinese and Botswana cultures while also furthering diplomatic relations. As of September 2016, 11 expert dance and calisthenics coaches from China had successfully trained more than 3,000 students and 150 instructors in Botswana since the signing of a memorandum of understanding between the two countries in December 2015. According to Tang Shenping, a political director at the Chinese Embassy, China has been involved in every BOT50 celebration since 1966.
staff_comments: This project appears to only have representational intent.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides technical assistance to support Golden Jubilee Celebrations in Botswana

# Description
In September 2016, the Chinese Embassy permitted the involvement of the China Yunnan Shangri-La arts troupe in the golden jubilee celebrations in Botswana. China also sent stretching and professional fitness coaches to Botswana, as well as costumes, performing equipment, and other materials to help the country celebrate BOT50, the Botswana independence celebration. This technical assistance comes as a way to blend Chinese and Botswana cultures while also furthering diplomatic relations. As of September 2016, 11 expert dance and calisthenics coaches from China had successfully trained more than 3,000 students and 150 instructors in Botswana since the signing of a memorandum of understanding between the two countries in December 2015. According to Tang Shenping, a political director at the Chinese Embassy, China has been involved in every BOT50 celebration since 1966.
justification: Project focuses on cultural exchange and social development through arts and fitness training
evidence: Technical assistance for cultural celebrations, dance and calisthenics training, cultural exchange focus
